description: The course provides a capstone to the major. Taught as a seminar, it offers an opportunity for students to integrate their studies of women and gender across disciplines and to become more aware of the intricate web of gender, race, culture, and class that informs women's experiences. Offered annually in the spring semester. Prerequisite: GSS 121; priority given to majors and concentrators.
name: Gender and Public Discourse
notes: Majors should contact the director to pre-register. Preference will be given to
Section topic: Girls, Girlhood, and Girl Culture
prerequisites: GSS 121; priority given to majors and concentrators.
title: Advanced Topics in Gender and Sexuality Studies
